params.note: Tissue collection: obtain viable (pink) tumor tissue; store in ice-cold basic medium with 10 µM Y-27632 or ice-cold PBS during transport to minimize cell death.
Tissue pieces collected and stored in media as soon as possible, ideally in operating room or pathological laboratory.
Organoids can be generated from tissue stored up to 72 h at 4 °C or from cryopreserved tissue, though efficiency is lower.
Mechanical fragmentation of tissue using scalpel or razor blades.

params.program: digest tissue fragments at 37 °C using enzymes (collagenase, Liberase, trypsin, TrypLE, hyaluronidase, dispase, DNase, EDTA); digestion time: 30 min to overnight; shake regularly to avoid clumping; add DNase if needed.

params.note: Plating cell preparations into drops of ECM hydrogel (BME or Matrigel; 2–10% or 50–100% in some cases); alternatives include piglet mesenchyme–derived ECM or defined matrices.

params.program: culture organoids at 37 °C and 5% CO2 in advanced DMEM/F12-based growth medium; refresh medium every 2–3 days; include 10 µM Y-27632 for first two passages.

params.note: Monitor cultures for bacterial/fungal infections; if infected, add 5 M NaOH, incubate 1 h, remove contents, wash with 70% ethanol, replace lid.
Use penicillin/streptomycin in basic medium; for colon/oral mucosa samples, add Primocin, vancomycin, gentamicin, and/or caspofungin for first two passages.

params.program: maintain organoid cultures under standard conditions; passage every 14 days with 1:2 split ratio.

params.note: For compact organoids: use TrypLE for passaging; monitor under microscope every 5 min; stop when mixture of 3–5 cell clusters and single cells observed; use P1000 pipette to aid disruption.
For cystic/grape-like organoids: use mechanical shearing instead of TrypLE.
Add 10 µM Y-27632 to medium immediately after passaging; discontinue after 2–3 days when medium is refreshed.
Freeze organoids 2–3 days after passaging when highly proliferative; avoid freezing single cells or large differentiated organoids.
Recovery rate after thawing >50%; recommend at least one passage after thawing before drug screening.
Thawed organoids may show altered morphology; additional passages may be needed for poor recovery.
QC: assess tumor purity of organoid culture using variant allele frequency from bulk DNA sequencing.
Tumor cell enrichment methods: Nutlin-3 for TP53 mutant selection; EGF withdrawal for RAS mutant selection; removal of Wnt/RSPO for specific mutation/subtype selection.
Use minimal medium selection with caution due to potential loss of heterogeneity and unknown genetic background.
Organoids are collected, filtered, counted, and plated at desired density for drug screening.
Therapy exposure: organoids exposed to drug 1 day after plating if plated as single cells; some protocols allow recovery period before treatment (1–24 days total exposure).
Readout typically performed 5–6 days after treatment start, but ranges from 1–24 days.
Response to therapy is comparable whether organoids are exposed as single cells or multicellular structures.
